message.content:
cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.CL, cs.SI 

This paper deals with the task of inferring social relationships and attributes from visual scenes, which is a problem in computer vision (cs.CV) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The proposed method involves training a neural network to generate a Social Relationship Graph, which is a structured representation of social relationships and attributes. This involves using memory cells like Gated Recurrent Units (GRUs) to iteratively update the social relationship states in a graph using scene and attribute context, which is a technique commonly used in deep learning (cs.LG). The paper also involves natural language processing (NLP) techniques, as the Social Relationship Graph involves representing relationships and attributes using a knowledge graph, which is a common technique in NLP (cs.CL). Finally, the paper deals with socially-intelligent agents, which is a topic in social informatics (cs.SI).
